str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Consequently, therefore, well then, so then. From toi and gar and oun; truly for then, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From a compound of a and a derivative of tithemi; to set aside, i.e. to disesteem, neutralize or violate.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From a compound of a and a derivative of tithemi; to set aside, i.e. to disesteem, neutralize or violate.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
